problem:
If $x$, $y$, and $z$ are real numbers for which  \begin{align*}
x+y-z &= -8, \\
x-y+z &= 18,\text{ and} \\
-x+y+z &= 30, \\
\end{align*} then what is $xyz$?
solution: Noticing that the left-hand sides are symmetric in $x$, $y$, and $z$ (in that any relabelling of the variables leads to one of the given left-hand sides), we sum all three equations to obtain $x+y+z=40$. Subtracting the first equation from $x+y+z=40$ gives $2z=48\implies z=24$. Similarly, subtracting the second equation from $x+y+z=40$ gives $y=11$. Finally, subtracting the third equation from $x+y+z=40$ gives $x=5$ so that $xyz=(5)(11)(24)=\boxed{1320}$.
